data.stimulus:
Let's start with VOCABULARY

Consider the words below. They are key words from the text.

 

 

 

 

 

  • Match each word with its meaning.

value: A person's sense of right and wrong
Looking at the whole situation, not just the details
To make things look or work in the same way
Producing large quantities of products by using machinery
Very common in a particular area or at a particular time
Something which happens with no reason or pattern
Pretend to agree with something but do nothing to support it

data.stimulus: Now, let's look at these words in context.  Complete each sentence with the missing word (drag and drop).
data.template:
1. Products can become more popular if they have been {{response}} by a celebrity.

  2. Without the proper {{response}} many businesses often fail.

  3. Entrepreneurs are often accused of having little or no {{response}}.

  4. Chinese students are {{response}} at Coventry University London.

  5. The company has several different problems so a {{response}} may be needed.

  6. If production processes are {{response}} businesses can save a lot of capital.

7. It could be argued that {{response}} transforms workers into robots.

8. The {{response}} for predicting the future of the economy is very complex.

9. Success in business can be extremely {{response}}.

10. Some members of parliament only {{response}} to the recent protests.

11. If you drive a car you must {{response}} to the instructions on street signs.

12. Many people buy cheap clothes only to {{response}} throw them away.

options.label: It must have a positive effect on the environment and a measure of sustainability
It must have a positive effect on the economy and a measure of sustainability
It must have a positive effect on the environment and a measure success

data.stimulus:
1. What is the key to producing all-round eco-friendly fashion?

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

2. Ecologically sound fashion needs to consist of products that are produced taking the environment into consideration.

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

options.label: Using energy when recycling when recycling soda bottles to generate fibres
Safely disposing of wastewater using organic processes

data.stimulus:
3. According to the text, what are some examples of steps involved in producing environmentally friendly clothes? (Choose 2)

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

options.label: The methods of production and the lifecycle of the materials
The methods of production is most significant

data.stimulus:
4. Apart from the raw material, what else needs to be considered?

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

5. What do most eco-aware customers look for?

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

6. What are the three essential factors for the success of eco-fashion?

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!

7. What is the role of fashion designers in the production of eco-friendly garments? (There are 3 answers that you do not need)

► Read the text carefully! You have only ONE 'check answer' attempt!
data.template: In the process of design development, a fashion designer would need to consider what {{response}} fabric to use, what {{response}} styles would be possible and what the prevalent {{response}} in fashion are.

data.stimulus:
In the next exercise, you are going to find phrases in the text that have the same meaning as the definitions in the FIRST column of the table below.

 

  1. Start by going to the text and read the PARAGRAPH where the word is  -- it's indicated in the SECOND column.

  2. When you find the word in the text, write it in the THIRD column.

 

(There is an example in the first line.)

value: To help the reader predict the content of the text and to understand what the writing style is.
To help the reader decide how to analyse the text and to help the reader recognize the techniques the writer has used to achieve that purpose.
Because different texts often present different viewpoints on the same topic
Because it helps the reader monitor comprehension and ensure you do not lose sight of your reason for reading.

data.stimulus:
In the previous Reading Lesson you considered the importance of Critical Reading.

 

► Let's review why this is important...
stimulus_list: Why is it important to analyze extra textual features before you begin reading it?
Why is it important to understand the writer’s purpose before and while you are reading a text?
Why is it often necessary to read more than one text on a particular topic when undertaking academic study?
How can asking questions about a text before reading it help you achieve your reading purpose?

value: To help the reader predict the content of the text and to understand what the writing style is.

Because it helps the reader monitor comprehension and ensure you do not lose sight of your reason for reading.
